verses.verse: ((1 David being now king over Judah, and having had many victories, showeth by evident signs that God elected him King, assuring the people that God will prosper them, if they approve the same.14 After, he prayeth unto God to finish that that he hath begun.) O God, thou hast cast us out, thou hast (For when Saul was not able to resist the enemy, the people fled hither and thither: for they could not be safe in their own houses.) scattered us, thou hast been angry, turn again unto us.
Thou hast made the land to tremble, and hast made it to (As cleft with an earthquake.) gape: heal the breaches thereof, for it is shaken.

Thou hast (Thou hast handled thy people sharply, in taking from them sense and judgment, in that they aided Saul the wicked King, and pursued him to whom God had given the just title of the realm.) showed thy people heavy things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of giddiness.

But now thou hast given (In making me king, thou hast performed thy promise, which seemed to have lost the force.) a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of thy truth. Selah.
That thy beloved may be delivered, help with thy right hand and hear me.

God hath spoken in his (It is so certain as if it were spoken by an oracle, that I shall possess those places which Saul hath left to his children.) holiness: therefore I will rejoice: I shall divide Shechem, and measure the valley of Succoth.

Gilead shall be mine, and Manasseh shall be mine: Ephraim also shall be the (For it was strong and well peopled.) strength of mine head: (David meaneth, that in this tribe his kingdom shall be established, Gen. 49:10.) Judah is my lawgiver.
Moab shall be my (In most vile subjection.) washpot: over Edom will I cast out my shoe: (For thou wilt dissemble, and feign as though thou werest glad.) Philistia show thyself joyful for me.
Who will lead me into the (He was assured that God would give him the strong cities of his enemies, wherein they thought themselves sure.) strong city? who will bring me unto Edom?
Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst cast us off, and didst not go forth, O God, with our armies?
Give us help against trouble: for vain is the help of man.
Through God we shall do valiantly; for he shall tread down our enemies.
